messages.title: VICTORY
messages.content: Local champions get buses restored and our local NHS improved

keyPolicies.policyDescription: £8 billion new funding for the NHS, better care fund
Recover £66bn from tax-dodgers and tax the very wealthy to pay more in tax
Two-thirds off bus fares for 16-21 year olds
Massively increasing housebuilding and helping people afford a home
A national programme to insulate homes, investing to make the UK a world leader in green hi-tech industries and improve broadband and communication networks.

issues.economy: With the economy now recovering, our vision and manifesto for the next 5 years is much bolder: we can see an end to austerity in the next Parliament, and create a fairer society - affordable homes, and decent public services for all.
issues.education: It is the next generation who really matter: the problems start when pupils fall behind at school, so our top priority to provide front-page of our 2010 manifesto from the range funding to support - the “pupil premium” has been the delivery of £14,579,000 of extra funding through the Liberal Democrats, benefiting 4,900 children in Suffolk Coastal, funding 10 little schools.
issues.health: £8 billion new funding for the NHS, Recover £66bn from tax-dodgers and tax the very wealthy to pay more in tax, Better Care Fund which gives £50 million to Suffolk to integrate local health and social care provision.

housing.content: Massively increasing housebuilding and helping people afford a home
